item.title: Rise of the Guardians: YouTube Experience
item.description: For DreamWorks Animation's Rise of the Guardians we build a custom YouTube takeover and YouTube channel to let users explore the extensive world of the Guardians through trailers, clips, drawing tutorials, behind-the-scenes footage and more. And to attract more people to this YouTube channel we also made a custom animated video featuring Jack Frost in a snowball fight.
item.content:encoded: For DreamWorks Animation's Rise of the Guardians we build a custom YouTube takeover and YouTube channel to let users explore the extensive world of the Guardians through trailers, clips, drawing tutorials, behind-the-scenes footage and more. And to attract more people to this YouTube channel we also made a custom animated video featuring Jack Frost in a snowball fight.

item.title: OPERATION SMILE | CALENDAR
item.description: ART DIRECTOR | Natalie Vella COPY WRITER | Melanie Horenz ILLUSTRATOR | Shy the Sun TYPOGRAPHER | Ben Johnston AWARDS | Gold Craft Loerie Award Operation Smile, is a non-profit organisation that provides free surgeries to repair cleft lips and palates in Southern Africa. In order to raise funds for these operations we developed an interactive birthday calendar demonstrating just how easy it is to fix a childs smile. The calendar arrives full of broken smiles. All you have to do to use the calendar is to fix the childs smile by flipping through the pages until the two halves match. Its that easy. Thanks to over a ? of a million rand generated from calendar sales, our client can continue fixing thousands of childrens smiles, changing their lives forever.
item.content:encoded: ART DIRECTOR | Natalie Vella COPY WRITER | Melanie Horenz ILLUSTRATOR | Shy the Sun TYPOGRAPHER | Ben Johnston AWARDS | Gold Craft Loerie Award Operation Smile, is a non-profit organisation that provides free surgeries to repair cleft lips and palates in Southern Africa. In order to raise funds for these operations we developed an interactive birthday calendar demonstrating just how easy it is to fix a childs smile. The calendar arrives full of broken smiles. All you have to do to use the calendar is to fix the childs smile by flipping through the pages until the two halves match. Its that easy. Thanks to over a ? of a million rand generated from calendar sales, our client can continue fixing thousands of childrens smiles, changing their lives forever.

item.title: BVLGARI Pavilion at Abu Dhabi Art 2012
item.description: The 2012 Bulgari Pavilion and b.lounge at Abu Dhabi Art 2012 by Not a Number Architects (NaNA). Commissioned by Bulgari as part of a VIP lounge for the Abu Dhabi Art at Manarat al Saadiyat Nov 2012 A completely self supporting structure built from 2272 Acrylic tubes and joined with 10,000 polycarbonate connectors. Bespoke lighting system by Artisan (United Visual Artists)
item.content:encoded: The 2012 Bulgari Pavilion and b.lounge at Abu Dhabi Art 2012 by Not a Number Architects (NaNA). Commissioned by Bulgari as part of a VIP lounge for the Abu Dhabi Art at Manarat al Saadiyat Nov 2012 A completely self supporting structure built from 2272 Acrylic tubes and joined with 10,000 polycarbonate connectors. Bespoke lighting system by Artisan (United Visual Artists)

item.title: Ronan & Erwan Bouroullec
item.description: A comprehensive monograph documenting the entire career to date of Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec (b.1971, 1976), who took the design world by storm with their first joint projects in the late 1990s and have continued to produce exceptional designs ever since, many of which have already become icons in international museums
item.content:encoded: A comprehensive monograph documenting the entire career to date of Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec (b.1971, 1976), who took the design world by storm with their first joint projects in the late 1990s and have continued to produce exceptional designs ever since, many of which have already become icons in international museums

item.title: IJUP 2012 Visual Identity
item.description: IJUP is an event created by University of Porto to promote young researchers and the investigation among undergraduate and graduate students. As a young researcher, after having studied the case for the second time, the conclusion from the previous identities was that the main purpose and environment of the event was never so much about to investigate, but to share all the investigations, creating a constant learning with the appearance of discussions. The initiative of creating a distinctive and iconic identity with the purpose of getting young students attention, resulted in a exploding "I", which stands for Individual, Information, Investigation and IJUP, in metaphor of the boom of information inherent to any research process and of an explosion of knowledge implied in the sharing environment of the event. The contrast between red and blue (warm and cold) suggests the event's dialogue of the humanistic and arts with the scientific and rational subjects. QR-codes were added to the poster, so any student could interact with it, by customizing the "I" with any photo they might fill, creating a wide collection of individual perspectives, much like the event.
item.content:encoded: IJUP is an event created by University of Porto to promote young researchers and the investigation among undergraduate and graduate students. As a young researcher, after having studied the case for the second time, the conclusion from the previous identities was that the main purpose and environment of the event was never so much about to investigate, but to share all the investigations, creating a constant learning with the appearance of discussions. The initiative of creating a distinctive and iconic identity with the purpose of getting young students attention, resulted in a exploding "I", which stands for Individual, Information, Investigation and IJUP, in metaphor of the boom of information inherent to any research process and of an explosion of knowledge implied in the sharing environment of the event. The contrast between red and blue (warm and cold) suggests the event's dialogue of the humanistic and arts with the scientific and rational subjects. QR-codes were added to the poster, so any student could interact with it, by customizing the "I" with any photo they might fill, creating a wide collection of individual perspectives, much like the event.

item.title: Platige Image Rebranding
item.description: After 15 years we decided to change the logo and comprehensively overhaul the Platige brand. The new logo, new website, and new visual identity serve as the pillars of the company's image, tying together the company's future development plans.

item.title: Units of Measure Calendar
item.description: The idea of creating a calendar was always at the top of our heads. However, we needed an idea that was sound, that made sense. We went back to our roots for that big idea, and we stumbled upon the fact our agency is named after a unit of measure. Things began to click into gear and the team worked to create a calendar that would highlight 12 units of measure . This brought a lot of symmetry to our design philosophy which melds sense and practicality together. This craft-centric calendar is designed to be practically functional as well as aesthetically pleasing.
item.content:encoded: The idea of creating a calendar was always at the top of our heads. However, we needed an idea that was sound, that made sense. We went back to our roots for that big idea, and we stumbled upon the fact our agency is named after a unit of measure. Things began to click into gear and the team worked to create a calendar that would highlight 12 units of measure . This brought a lot of symmetry to our design philosophy which melds sense and practicality together. This craft-centric calendar is designed to be practically functional as well as aesthetically pleasing.

item.title: 2012 Twenty Things That Happened On The Internet
item.description: 2012 twenty things that happened on the internet Illustration done for Syzygy UK Ltd ( London ) " One internet year, one illustration, 20 things: can you spot them all ? " Spread across this picture by Parisian illustrator Niark1 are references to 20 different events that happened on the internet in 2012. They range from big business deals to LOL-memes, with the annual nod to a deceased technology visionary and an obligatory rainbow (see 2011 and 2010). Your job is to identify all 20 things. http://20things.syzygy.net
item.content:encoded: 2012 twenty things that happened on the internet Illustration done for Syzygy UK Ltd ( London ) " One internet year, one illustration, 20 things: can you spot them all ? " Spread across this picture by Parisian illustrator Niark1 are references to 20 different events that happened on the internet in 2012. They range from big business deals to LOL-memes, with the annual nod to a deceased technology visionary and an obligatory rainbow (see 2011 and 2010). Your job is to identify all 20 things. http://20things.syzygy.net
